summary:
I'm a writer, director and creative who specialises in film and content for digital.

I've been lucky enough to work with some great brands across of an array of fantastic projects, I've worked in-house and independently. I've directed, edited and motion designed everything from cinema adverts, digital content that supports above the line campaigns, groundbreaking interactive websites, short films and all that's in-between.

I’m constantly striving for capturing authentic moments on film. I believe that genuine emotions evoke genuine emotional reactions and this informs everything I do.

I want to be involved with the making of brilliant work.

treasury_media.title: Google Night Walk
treasury_media.description: Explore the sounds, streets and soul of Marseille on this immersive digital Nightwalk with Google. Winner of two FWA awards and two Cannes Lions including a silver Cyber Lion for Storytelling.

treasury_media.title: Glassworks directs for Playstation. | Glassworks Amsterdam
treasury_media.description: Filming took place both on location, at night, in the forests outside of Amsterdam, and then technical plates were gathered in the green screen studio later. Once in post, Dan directed the character animation, including modelling, texturing and rigging a variety of Playstation characters, until we were able to bring both worlds together in Flame with Morten's 2D team.

awards.title: Digital Campaign of the Year for Google Nightwalk
Cannes Cyber Lions / Silver – Craft: Storytelling for Google Nightwalk

projects.title: EA Sports - The Quest For The Best
projects.description:
Lloyd Griffith is on a quest to find the best 11 football players in the world. With a challenge from his friends back in Grimsby, Lloyd's journey takes him all over the world meeting experts, visionaries & players alike to properly do his research.

I was approached to create a 6 minute film for EA Sports about Lloyd's Journey. Along the way it organically turned into a 24 minute documentary that was eventually premiered on Sky Sports 1 on Tuesday 5th January and then lived online. 

As a football fan, this was a dream job for me, getting to talk about football for 3 months with some of the greatest minds in the game, and Lloyd Griffith. I joke. It was a lot of fun and made easier by the great crew and Lloyd being effortlessly funny on camera.

projects.title: RTLZ Brand Film
projects.description: Bringing to life the rebrand of the RTL business channel, RTLZ. The idea was to emphasize the continual movement forward with the one point perspective, utilising Ivo Schoofs massive Pendulum Wave Structure. For me this was a maths based problem, measuring time x length x distance and all sorts of other equations that I thought I would never need again after GCSE Physics.

projects.title: Costa and A Kip
projects.description: A short piece for Costa Coffee and their Costa and a Kip promotion. Released April 1st.

contributors.headline: Global Creative Lead - Play Inclusion, Co-Founder of #OnlyOneInTheRoom

projects.title: The Breath Before
projects.description: Award-winning brand film for the Cystic Fibrosis Trust that found a new way to illustrate the battle of daily life with CF through compelling, emotional storytelling. It became the Trust's most successful video within 3 days of going online.

contributors.headline: Storyteller & charity leader. Mental health evangelist.

projects.title: The Few and Far Between
projects.description: I spent the summer of 2014, traveling around all the nooks and crannies of America finding the best bar stories the country had to offer. Documenting the stories in photography, audio and film, we created a website full of amazing, unlikely and downright unbelievable stories for Jack Daniels. I was the Digital Director for the project, creating and overseeing creation of all of the content for the site.

projects.title: Google Night Walk in Marseille
projects.description: I was the Digital Director of Google's first Nightwalk, taking people through an interactive evening walk through Marseille. Working through MediaMonks and with 72 and Sunny Amsterdam, this innovative digital experience has recently won The Digital Campaign of the Year at the Shots Awards, a Grand Prix at the Epica awardsm 2 Cannes Cyber Lions (including one for storytelling) and 2 x FWA awards.

projects.title: Kate Tempest's Brand New Ancients
projects.description: I was approached by Battersea Arts Centre to interpret Kate Tempest's award winning poem Brand New Ancients. This series of films acts as an introduction to Kate's vivid world and her fated characters. The poem is 'an everyday epic', so with that in mind, I was looking to show people in everyday situations with an unreal, epic edge.

projects.title: Run Dem Crew Projects
projects.description:
Commisioned by Nike to tell the history of Charlie Dark's infamous East London Run Club. 

An immense journey powered by an towering individual.

Part Two can be seen here: https://vimeo.com/32140379

Half a year later, I was also commisioned to document the RunDemCrew's youth initiative 'The Youngers Project" - https://vimeo.com/35285167 & https://vimeo.com/33665495 

All Film Direction by me. Edit by myself and James Harrison. Produced by AKQA & pd3

projects.title: Intel PowerUp
projects.description: Creatively conceiving, directing and editing the hero piece and behind the scenes content for the Intel Power Up campaign.

projects.title: Nike #MAKEITCOUNT
projects.description:
Nike has launched a campaign for the new year, suggesting that we all step up and 'Make It Count'. The campaign stars a number of the UK's top athletes making personal pledges for 2012. It then encourages everyone else to join in on Twitter, by announcing their own goals via the hashtag #makeitcount.

Created by Wieden + Kennedy London and AKQA, the campaign includes a series of posters shot by photographer Adam Hinton, which show the athletes at the most intense (and at times painful-looking) moments during training. Each athlete's pledge is then written on top of the image. These vary from the straightforward – "Don't dream of winning. Train for it." from Mo Farah – to the stark: Paula Radclliffe's poster simply states that "nearly isn't enough". In addition there is a series of online films, directed by Joe Roberts, expanding on the theme.

contributors.headline: Live experience & branded content production specialist
Award winning UK based Director Of Photography.

profile_positions.description: Directing and producing various projects from the ground up, working closely brands, charities and musicians to create original and arresting storytelling.
profile_positions.title: Film Director (Freelance)

profile_positions.description: I'm represented for commercial work in the UK by the fantastic 2AM films.
profile_positions.title: Film Director

profile_positions.description: A freelance film and digital director for MediaMonks, creating truly immersive interactive experiences such as the multi award winning Google Nightwalk and Jack Daniels' Few and Far.
profile_positions.title: Film and Digital Director (Freelance)

profile_positions.description:
After a very successful first year of creating a content department within pd3, I officially became the Head of Content and expanded the department. We took on a full-time in-house director and editor and worked with a wide pool of freelancers.

As Head of Content, my role evolved into that of a creative director for the department. Day to day tasks included; writing treatments, directing shoots, managing post production and overseeing the output of pd3’s content as a whole. At the same time I was directly involved in both the editing and creating of motion graphics for many pieces, including work for new clients; Intel and Live Nation. 

I was flying all over the world, directing shoots, managing edits and liaising directly with international clients whilst working under the tightest of deadlines.

The department continues to grow, the work becomes more varied and the quality continues to win pd3 more work and more awards.
profile_positions.title: Head of Content

profile_positions.description:
I was approached by London based creative agency pd3 to develop a content department in-house to produce films and branded content in order to support pd3’s experiential and digital advertising output. 

One of my initial objectives was to create and curate content for the O2 Academy’s new YouTube channel, ‘O2 Academy TV’, focusing on the many artists and music acts that perform across their 15 venues throughout the UK. After a year, the channel had clocked up to over 2 million hits and was winning awards for it’s work with O2 Academy’s Social strategies.

I also brought work into the agency from the contacts I had made from my freelancing days, most notably Nike and AKQA. I was approached to direct a series of films created to support the #makeitcount campaign of Christmas 2011 and various other documentary/short films for Nike’s social media spaces.

I also began working on projects in a purely creative capacity, including taking creative direction of the ‘Little Boxes’ campaign for the O2 brand. A piece of work that took me Canada to work with the band ‘Walk Off The Earth’, this film garnered over 7 million hits and was nominated for 2 awards.
profile_positions.title: Content Producer

profile_positions.description:
In 2007 I created a content company that dealt directly with a variety of brands and businesses by making interesting and clickable content for their websites. Using my connections and experience from the live music sector, TICC focused on content centred around promoting live events. From pre- event trailers, podcasts, event overviews and motion graphic based flyers to full festival coverage, multi-camera live shoots and spoken word epics. 

Working with brands such as K-Swiss, Nike, Big Chill, Brownswood Recordings, Havana Club and many more.
profile_positions.title: Founder and Director

profile_positions.description:
Working at one of East London’s most popular live music venues and club, I was Cargo’s sole Press Officer. I liaised with print and online press on a day to day basis, writing and publicising the huge range of cutting edge live acts and superstar DJs that played Cargo each week.

Additionally I was given the responsibility of establishing Cargo’s brand new website by creating and managing it’s content. Catering for the emerging 2.0 market, engaging with the burgeoning social media phenomenon and organising audio visual content, whilst continuing my role as Cargo’s Press Officer, It was in my role as Website Co-ordinator that I spotted a gap in the market for creating content for websites and my love affair with content creation began.
profile_positions.title: Press Officer
